alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 04 at 11:03PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Bay and Midland. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several rounds of showers and thunderstorms remain possible late tonight and in the morning which could result in rainfall totals of 1 to 1.5 inches. This combined with wet soils from recent rainfalls over the last few days may lead to flooding across parts of the area. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
